node.text: A tragic tale with too many twists and turns to recount, for sure... But in short, an ambitious sorcerer by the name of Desrin Arthraime had proclaimed himself The Mage King and rightful ruler of the Vhosphoran Kingdom. Thus he challenged the Queen at the time, Valinda Vhos, whose forces were spearheaded by the Queen's elite companions of magi, the Vhosphoran Circle of Nine.

The Hydrobor Magi chose to ally with the Queen, of course - Arthraime's vision for the future of the country had no place for us. I was but a young, aspiring mage at the time, but I remember vividly the day the Vhosphoran Nine arrived at our academy; Gaberion Theraliss in his full regalia - their leader at the time, though he later became... broken - meeting with our legendary Archmage Eveniss Charandale...

<color=#9C8C77>*You notice the eyes of the old mage glisten as he stares into his distant memories.*</color>\n\nTogether we fought and defeated the False King Desrin Arthraime, though it came at a heavy cost. In the eyes of the common people, the war had been orchestrated generally by wielders of magic - 'The Sorcerer's War', they said - and soon we were no longer welcome in our own lands. The war had ended, but many sad events followed - the suffering it caused continued for long to come, perhaps even to this day.

Finally we're about to have some action worthy of our skills! It's time the Mercoss Band shows these peasants how real warriors fight. Once the bloodshed begins, the peasant-line will most likely cower, but the Mercoss warriors will be there to carry us through!

option.optiontext: As you say.

node.text: I'll admit I'm a little nervous, I've never been in a fight before... But old Master Traberius sent Ahnring and Gendaril here to watch my back. They are very experienced magi, I'm sure they won't let anything happen to me.

It brings me confidence to see you among our ranks, knowing what a capable fighter you are. If not for you, I would still find myself troubled by the bandit leaders of western Haywind. It is only proper that I now in turn fulfil my duty against the Bandit Lord's fortress.

option.optiontext: Very good.

node.text: Wouldn't have guessed when I first laid my eyes on you that you'd bring about such a change in our fortunes against the bandit horde. It's time Deputy Rieler and I now do our part in restoring order back to this land!

option.optiontext: Very good.

node.text: Thus ended the life of the Bandit Lord Blackshield, tougher in his resistance than I had thought... somewhere along there he bashed me about with that shield of his - nothing grievous, mind you! - but I'll need to catch my breath for a moment... ughhh... such a fool I am!

I keep telling myself ''come now, Zathe, you're too old for this stuff'', but here I find myself again, always looking for battle! Anyway, why don't you take a look around, while I rest here and complain to myself? See if you can find something that would shed more light on this Blackshield-character, eh? I for one am dying to know where he came from.

option.optiontext: Do you think this is it, that the threat to Haywind is no more?
As you say.

node.text: I'm sure straggler groups of bandits will continue to camp in these lands for some time to come, there'll be cleaning to do... and that'll be a job for someone other than me, I think. With their leaders gone, they won't pose the same threat to our lands ever again. That's enough to set my mind at ease.

option.optiontext: As you say.

node.text: Thus was the end of ''Lord Blackshield'' of Haywind... Whether the Mayor will acknowledge us as heroes remains to be seen, but in my eyes we have done well, you and I. Not to worry, I'll find a way to properly reward all who joined Haywind's defense here. Now, did you find anything to strip the mystery around Lord Blackshield's origins?

option.optiontext: Take a look at his correspondence...
Feeling any better yet?

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*Zathe reads the letter you provided with furrowed brows. His eyes widen as he reaches the end of the letter.*</color>\n\nAzzar Kheyn?! That slimy pretense of a merchant! He was never looking out for any guild interests, instead he's been the one plotting this bandit conspiracy behind the scenes - Lord Blackshield appears to have been merely another pawn! All this time the man was taking me for a fool, how could I not see this?!

We should never have allowed that scoundrel to take root in our chambers! He always did have an inexplicable influence over the Mayor... but in the face of this damning letter, no amount of weasel words can save him! We should return to camp and prepare to confront Kheyn.

option.optiontext: What do you make of the ominous threats at the end of the letter?
Very well, let's get to it.

node.text: Ah, I'll be fine, just got bashed around by the black shield there for a bit. I keep telling myself ''come now, Zathe, you're too old for this stuff'', but here I find myself again, always looking for battle! May this have been my last... Anyway, were you able to find anything to strip the mystery around Lord Blackshield's origins?

option.optiontext: Take a look at his correspondence...
I'm not done looking around yet...

node.text: I'm not sure yet... But whatever his plans, we must have foiled them. He seemed intent on extorting a tribute from Haywind and that won't be happening now. We must simply confront him and capture him, then he'll have a lot of explaining to do.

option.optiontext: Very well, let's get to it.

node.text: Ah, good that you're here. To the distress of young Sasha, the Mayor and the traitor Azzar seem to already have found her. But this gathering presents us exactly with the right opportunity to bring truth to light, don't you think? What say you, we interrupt their argument with our news and grant Sasha some relief?

option.optiontext: Yes, let's do that.
What's the plan regarding Azzar Kheyn?
There's no hurry, I want to watch them for a while.

node.text: While those three have been preoccupied by their shouting match, I've quietly let our friends know about Azzar's treachery - they stand ready to seize him. All that remains is for us to step in and expose him in front of the Mayor.

option.optiontext: Do you think he'll put up a fight?
Yes, let's do this.
There's no hurry, I want to watch them for a while.

node.text: Surely not? I don't know about you, but he strikes me as a schemer - the brains of the operation - where Blackshield provided the grunt. Besides, he's walked into our camp all alone, while there are many of us. I expect he'll understand the situation once it's made clear to him.

option.optiontext: Let's do this then.
There's no hurry, I want to watch them for a while.

node.text: Very well, follow my lead, friend.

<color=#9C8C77>*The fool of a mayor reads the letter and all color flees from his face. Soon, Sasha snatches the letter from his hands to read for herself, and gasps. The Mayor struggles for words:*</color>\n\nWell, I... there must be some kind of a mistake, surely... Azzar will be able to explain the meaning of this, I have no doubt...

Why, there's nothing to explain - the meaning of this letter is wholly unambiguous! Azzar Kheyn, you are a traitor and a conspirator against Haywind! The only thing we need to hear from you is why - why have you been doing this?! Your letter says you seek vengeance, but as far as I know, we have done nothing to slight you!
Sasha, please, let's not be hasty... there must be a reasonable explanation to all of this... Azzar, please...?

Oh, be silent, you fool! I tire of your incessant prattling! You were so easily manipulated, but for one spineless failure - you would not keep your daughter in check, no matter how many times I told you! If not for that, we would not even be here now!
So we see your true colors at last, Azzar! You have a lot to answer for... and you may do so from inside the dungeons we'll have prepared for you!
A quaint notion, Zathe, my 'friend'. Of course, you would not speak with such confidence, had you any idea who you were really speaking to. But it matters not, soon you will learn.

option.optiontext: I'm keen to hear, what vengeance were you seeking against Haywind?
You sought to extort a tribute, what was it for, Kheyn?
I've heard enough.

node.text: I do not have the patience to explain myself! My quarrel is with no individual alone. The city gave shelter to the Magi of Hydrobor and benefited greatly from it! I will be satisfied only when both the city and the magi have been reduced to rubble!

option.optiontext: But the tribute you sought to extort, what was it for, Kheyn?
I've heard enough.

node.text: Why, for the greedy ogres of Amarien's Mountains, hahaha! I promised them such gold in exchange for loyalty, but now it seems I'll have to motivate them by other means. A minor setback in the grand scheme of things, I recently came upon just the tool I need...

option.optiontext: But what vengeance were you seeking against Haywind?
Don't think you're leaving here as a free man, Kheyn.

node.text: As have I... Come then, little heroes, show me what you're worth! I thought you were eager to put me in chains, were you not?!
Is that so...? Come then, little heroes, show me what you're worth! Come and put me in chains, like you're so eager to do!

It seems I underestimated Azzar... Whatever foul magics he employed knocked the living out of me back there. I do not yet know the extent of the threat he poses, but it is not to be ignored - such a dangerous man must not be allowed to walk free!

option.optiontext: What are you planning to do?
Had you any idea he'd turn out to be a renegade wizard?

node.text: Well, I always found the man detestable, but then many of us did. I think he played the part of an obnoxious, arrogant merchant well. But no, I never suspected he was anything more than what he appeared to be.

By my estimation, he must be quite a powerful wizard too... It is possible for one trained in magic to sense the magical capabilities of another, but there also exist tricks to mask those abilities. I could sense nothing from Azzar Kheyn before he revealed himself to us back there.

option.optiontext: So what are you planning to do about him?
Let's pick this up later.

node.text: He kept mentioning Amarien's Mountains due east... The bandit horde seems to have been only one part of Azzar's plan to siege Haywind, but something has been developing in those mountains that we've been unaware of. Now that we exposed him and put a stop to his schemes here, I assume he too retreated towards Amarien's. That's where we must follow him, to investigate what he may have set in motion, and to hunt him down once and for all.

Yes, and I will joining too! Azzar specifically named the Hydrobor Magi as his enemies and I wish to know why. I did not think we had any enemies in these lands! Hmm, perhaps I ought to consult the Archmage of our Circle and inquire if anything is known of Azzar's reputation. I can travel fast through magic and catch up with you once you've reached the mountains.
Indeed, and how about you, Master Aercrest? Dare I still count on your aid in hunting down this enemy of ours, who so shrouded himself in deceit?

option.optiontext: What do we know of Amarien's Mountains?
What do we know so far about Azzar Kheyn?
You may count me in, I will join your hunt for Azzar.
I need time to mull this over.

node.text: Indeed, and how about you, Mystery Guardian? Dare I still count on your aid in hunting down this enemy of ours, who so shrouded himself in deceit?

option.optiontext: What do we know of Amarien's Mountains?

I need time to mull this over.

node.text: Indeed, and how about you, adventurer? Dare I still count on your aid in hunting down this enemy of ours, who so shrouded himself in deceit?

option.optiontext: What do we know of Amarien's Mountains?
What do we know so far about Azzar Kheyn?
You may count me in, I will join your hunt for Azzar.
I need time to mull this over.

node.text: Amarien's mountain range lies to the east, separating Imberthale's woodlands from the powerful Kingdom of Melloria. Very few precarious passes lead across its mighty peaks and it's always been a great natural barrier against would-be invaders. Savage barbarians clans are known to camp in its foothills, and brutish ogres dwell within its caves.

Due east, beyond the Mistywood, a passage leads to the last shelter of civilization within Amarien's Foothills - The Bulwark Cliff. It takes truly hardened folk to live in that land, as they're far from any protection but their own. Their village will also serve as a good base for us, from which to survey the land.

option.optiontext: What do we know so far about Azzar Kheyn?
You may count me in, I will join your hunt for Azzar.
I need time to mull this over.

node.text: Not much beyond what was apparent in his letter to Lord Blackshield. He seems to harbor a hatred for us Magi of Hydrobor, but I do not know why. An old enemy, perhaps? That's why I ought to consult our Archmage, to inquire whether he might know anything of Azzar's reputation.

Ultimately my concern lies only with the protection of Haywind. Whoever Azzar is, whatever his motivations may be, he has declared himself an enemy of the city. It is my duty to hunt him down and to put an end to his schemes for good.

option.optiontext: What do we know of Amarien's Mountains?
You may count me in, I will join your hunt for Azzar.
I need time to mull this over.

node.text: Then we will stay here for the time being and prepare.

You never let us down! We must first make our way to the village of Bulwark Cliff. The mountain pass that leads us there lies at the far edge of the Mistywood heading east. I'll rush ahead and make camp at its base, from there we can take the rest of the journey together.

Father's in quite the shock... but on the upside, you exposed and awful traitor, AND I hear you took down the Bandit Lord Blackshield! The city really owes you! It's just, um... I don't really have the power to reward you properly. And my father doesn't seem to be in the right state of mind to discuss much of anything...

option.optiontext: The Mayor's... not in his right mind?

node.text: Uhm... I suppose not, but at least I hope it's not permanent. I mean... are you alright there, father?
Um... oh...? Hummm...\n\n<color=#9C8C77>*The Mayor seems stuck in a state of stupor, he stares blankly into the distance without meeting your gaze.*</color>
Definitely not alright... I fear his political career is over, but that may be for the best. I just hope he'll regain most of himself in time.

option.optiontext: Good luck, Sasha.

node.text: Looks like the Mayor's here, and he doesn't seem all too happy by our endeavor... Can't help but wonder what that means for my reward. What do you think; might have been too much to hope that slaying Blackshield would earn us a hero's welcome, eh?

option.optiontext: We uncovered proof that Azzar Kheyn is a traitor.

node.text: Shhh, keep that down, would you? We don't want to spook the man now that he's so kindly walked himself into our camp, offering himself up to be captured. Zathe's already let us know, we're to pounce on Azzar on his mark...

option.optiontext: Very good.

node.text: I can't believe we just did that... Can't believe *I* just did that! Gosh, are battles always like that? I never expected it could be so thrilling!

option.optiontext: We uncovered proof that Azzar Kheyn is a traitor.

node.text: Yes, Zathe already let us know, quietly of course. You don't expect more fighting, do you...? No, of course not, he must surrender - he's completely outmatched! Well, whatever happens, I'm ready to aid in apprehending the man.

option.optiontext: Very good.

node.text: Glad to see you in one piece, never know what's gonna happen in a fight like that. Things devolve to pure chaos, just gotta push through... but we got him in the end, didn't we? Got that Blackshield nice and good, alright...

option.optiontext: We uncovered proof that Azzar Kheyn is a traitor.

node.text: Aye, so Zathe told me. Looks like there's one more loose end to tie up before we can get some well deserved rest, eh? Well we stand ready and vigilant, the traitor Kheyn won't be escaping us.

option.optiontext: Very good.

node.text: And there it is... Once again, with your formidable support, we took down more bandit leaders, and this time the worst of them fell - Lord Blackshield himself. Not so long ago I felt rather bleak about Haywind's prospects in the face of this menace. How quickly our fortunes changed, since you came along - you have my gratitude.

option.optiontext: We uncovered proof that Azzar Kheyn is a traitor.

node.text: Indeed, Zathe's taken the rounds and alerted us all to it. We just took down the Bandit Lord himself, I do not expect Kheyn to give us all that much trouble. With that said, we're more than prepared to jump on him given the order.

option.optiontext: Very good.

node.text: Everyone's so shocked about Kheyn turning out to be some kind of renegade wizard. Of course you can't know something like that, but I've seen enough underworld business to guess there was more to the man than met the eye. You learn to never do business with someone who gives off a bad aura.

option.optiontext: Speaking of business, chance on any interesting goods lately?

node.text: Always! While everyone else was so busy fighting in Blackshield's fortress, I wrapped my fingers around some loot in passing. I mean, it's not like anyone else was picking it up, and I can't expect payment from the Mayor any time soon, what with the state he's in. I'd be happy to trade some of the stuff to you for a friendly price - got a few interesting goodies sent by cousin Slick Eddie too.
You're some new guy? I wasn't told to expect a new guy. Eh, nobody ever tells anything to anyone around here. Anyway, get to it then, do some guarding.

option.optiontext: Care for some beer?

node.text: Wait, wait, wait... what are you saying?! You bring corruption and ruin with you into this temple of discipline?! And you offer it to me, your superior?! You think there won't be consequences?!

...bwahhahahaha! Just messin' with you, should've seen your face! Ahh... brilliant move, new guy, this post is dull as churning butter. Beer's the best way into the good graces of your fellow men around here, myself included. C'mon then, throw a couple pints this way!

option.optiontext: Ah... haha... here you go...
option.actions: SetVar=Q110StaffordBeeryd-1,RemoveItems=296-2-true,NpcChat=You've made a good impression on me> recruit!

option.optiontext: Hold on, I'll get some more...

node.text: Gah, all these smartmouth prisoners do is get on my nerves! Wish we were allowed to 'educate' them, but Marshal's forbidden us. Just gotta let off steam some way, you know?

option.optiontext: I've got just the thing - beer!

node.text: Oh, whaaat?! Yesssirr! I could use more than one!

option.actions: SetVar=Q110CrawfordBeeryd-1,RemoveItems=296-2-true,NpcChat=Time to drown out the prisoners' drivel!

option.optiontext: Hold on, I'll get some more...

node.text: Don't worry about anything, this isn't an important post. The bars and locks are doing our work for us. This place gets too boring sometimes!

option.optiontext: Guess what's not boring though - beer!

node.text: You're joking? You actually brought beer in here? The Marshal'd be livid if he saw us drinking... but he's not down here, is he? What do I care, pass me one then.

option.optiontext: My pleasure...
How's it going?
Alright then, how about a beer?
I'll leave you to it.
Here you go...

node.text: We probably shouldn't be chatting idly. The Marshal doesn't like us doing that, not when we're supposed to perform our duties...

option.optiontext: Care for some beer?

node.text: I... probably shouldn't... really shouldn't be caught doing that. You mustn't tempt me! Move along now!
Halt, traveler! You approach a militia camp. These lands are riddled with raiders. State your business.

option.optiontext: I merely come seeking shelter and information.
Do you need any assistance? I can handle myself in a fight.

node.text: The raiders are a treacherous bunch, ambushing unsuspecting travelers and caravans. Our scouts suggest they have a fortress to the north. We're keeping an eye out, but numbers are against us. It's wise to be cautious.

option.optiontext: Aren't you able to provide protection for travelers?
Do you need any assistance? I can handle myself in a fight.

node.text: A capable fighter is always welcome. Sergeant Axfall normally leads us, but one of the Marshal's deputies in the camp is actually on the lookout for an exceptional recruit. Might want to consider talking to him.

option.optiontext: I merely come seeking shelter and information.
Aren't you able to provide protection for travelers?

node.text: We're doing our best, but we can't escort every traveler. Stick to the main roads during the day and avoid traveling at night. It's the best advice I can give you. Stay safe out there.

option.optiontext: I merely come seeking shelter and information.
Do you need any assistance? I can handle myself in a fight.

node.text: Yeah, what?

option.optiontext: Where can you take me?
Who are you?

node.text: Well, why don't you tell me where you're headed first and then we'll see, eh?

option.optiontext: South gate of the town...
Western watchtower...
North barracks...

node.text: What do you mean who am I? I'm the cart guy obviously, I cart folk around swiftly. Sometimes they get suspicious, call me out on witchcraft and such - say it seems like I can be in many places at once. Horseradish, I just move around a lot and quickly too!

option.optiontext: Where can you take me?

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*For a moment your mind fumbles for an awkward excuse. Then you realize the man is completely delirious, his eyes swaying wildly from side to side. Fever seems to have addled his brains.*</color>
Mother...! How many times must I tell you...?! I'm a... big man now... you mustn't rummage through my sock drawer without my permission...!

option.optiontext: Errr... yes, mother's here to take care of you, go back to bed...

node.text: Yes, mother... could really use some cookies and milk to feel better... when you have the time...\n\n<color=#9C8C77>*With that the man waddles back to bed.*</color>
